result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Hans E Schroeder in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss and read-in. Court grants. Apply any bail to 15CT895 and refund any balance.
Motion hearing on August 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Richard E. Poulson in court.   Defendant Hans E Schroeder did not appear.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on June 27, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Conditions modified

CASH BAIL PREVIOUSLY POSTED.  DEFENDANT IS RELEASED FROM REPORTING / COMPLYING WITH WCS.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Hans E Schroeder in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties to call the legal clerk to schedule motion by 6/8/2016.  Check Case scheduled for June 9, 2016 at 08:00 am.
Motion hearing on June 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Cases 15CT895, 16CM289, and 15CM1851 called for a motion to dismiss.  Defendant Hans E Schroeder in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bayer makes statements regarding a motion for an adjournment of these matters.  Attorney Poulson makes statements.  Court grants the request for an adjournment.  Court takes these matters off the trial calendar and sets this case for a full day motion hearing on 6/7/2016 when the jury trial had been scheduled.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Motion hearing on May 13, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
to Dismiss - Unconstitutional Stop, filed by Atty Poulson
Jury status hearing on June 2, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on June 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Hans E Schroeder in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on April 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Hans E Schroeder in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Hearing at 03-21-2016 09:30 am

Cases 16CM289, 15CM1851, 15CT895, and 15TR3809 called.  Defendant Hans E Schroeder in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Poulson moves for additional time on theses matters since he has just been retained.  Court continues the hearing in the refusal case to another date.  Hearing scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Hearing at 02-29-2016 02:30 pm

Defendant Hans E Schroeder in court.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bayer makes statements regarding the refusal decision.  Defendant request to adjourn this matter.  State has no objections.  Court sets this case for the same time of the oral ruling in the other case.  Court removes this case from the trial calendar.  Hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Hans E Schroeder in court with attorney Michael Hart.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Hearing at 10-22-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Hans E Schroeder in court.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Hart is not present.  Defendant has not had enough time to speak with his attorney.  This case was put on at the last moment after being released from jail.    Bail remains as fixed.  Court sets this case at the same time as his other case.  Hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant allowed non collect phone calls.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Hans E Schroeder in court, in custody.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney. Public Defender was unable to meet with the defendant. Defendant is represented by Atty. Michael Hart on other cases but stated he might no have him continue as counsel.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY THE COURT.  Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
